newsitem.title: USA: Tech stocks off amid reports of Microsoft delay.
newsitem.headline: Tech stocks off amid reports of Microsoft delay.

text.p: Reports that the successor to Microsoft Corp's Windows 95 operating system may be delayed put pressure on an already weak technology sector, analysts said.
The Nasdaq Composite Index dropped almost 13 points or 1.02 percent to 1241. The Philadelphia Stock Exchange's semiconductor index slipped 3.20 points to 255.87.
"There's just a general sell-off in the techs on the news that Windows '97 will be Windows '98," said Tia-Min Pang, an analyst with Smith Barney.
Microsoft, which shed 3-1/4 to 90-3/4, led the decline in technology shares. Cisco Systems Inc lost 1-7/8 to 47-3/8 and Novellus Systems Inc dropped 4-1/2 to 64-1/2.
"Besides Microsoft, it's not a company-specific decline; it's just continued weakness in the sector that was made worse today," said Gunnar Miller, an analyst with PaineWebber.
The general weakness throughout the technology sector has made stocks especially vulnerable to any news -- positive or negative -- analysts said.
"With that type of sensitivity, something like this Microsoft thing sets off a profound wave of selling," said said Drew Peck, an analyst with Cowen & Co.
"Fear has overtaken greed as the primary motivation in the market," Peck said.
Some analysts said investors overreacted to concerns over the possible delay of the Windows 95 update.

There were a few bright spots amid the overall slump by technology issues. International Business Machines Corp gained 3-1/2 to 135-7/8. Gateway 2000 Inc rose 1-3/8 to 51-7/8, and Sun Microsystems Inc added 3/4 to 28-1/2.
Intel Corp added 1/4 to 130-3/4 after the company said it was still "very bullish" on its ability to execute on its aggressive new product plans.
